Question: How to send data to the same application installed on other android device using wifi: :i have an application on my android device like "A" and same application installed on the other android device like "B", now i want to send data from app "A" to app "B" using WIFI service. so please suggest me how can i implement this feature.i tried many times to get help from google but all is vain.it is possible from WIFI direct or NFC.
Please using this api: DataOutputStream.write.

A: The problem is with the encoding of the text. You are using the UTF-8 encoding which can handle emojis. The emojis are not being corrupted because they are being correctly encoded.

In your code, you are using the DataOutputStream.write method to write the text to the output stream. This method uses the UTF-8 encoding by default. UTF-8 is capable of encoding all Unicode characters, including emojis.

So, the emojis are not being corrupted when you send them. The problem is with the receiving side. The receiving side is interpreting the bytes as if they are in a different encoding, which is why you see the corruption.

To solve this problem, you need to ensure that the receiving side is using the same encoding as the sending side. In your case, both sides are using UTF-8, so the problem should be solved.

If you are still seeing the corruption, it could be due to a problem with the receiving side. You should check the documentation of the API you are using to see how it handles encoding. If it uses a different encoding, you should use that encoding when you send the data.

For your second question, if you want to send data between two devices over WiFi, you can use the WiFi Direct feature of Android. WiFi Direct allows you to establish a virtual network interface that devices can use to communicate with each other. You can use the Android WiFi Direct API to set up and manage the virtual network interface.

Here is a link to the Android WiFi Direct API documentation: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/net/wifi/WifiDirectManager

Please note that using WiFi Direct requires the user to have a Wi-Fi router on their home network. If the user does not have a router, they will need to connect their Android device to a Wi-Fi router to use WiFi Direct.
